Title: Python Developer
Description:
PYTHON DEVELOPER

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for motivated Consultants with experience in Python Developmentt to join our teams in Lisbon.

In this role you will be responsible for:


Integrate DEV Team using Agile practices to ensure communication, work distribution and knowledge sharing.
Develop, test, document and deploy solutions for new functionalities or bug fixing accordingly with client Code standards.
Be an ambassador of Secure Coding.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Foundation layer, working with other Product Teams (Azure Platform Engineers and Management) and other transversal IT teams such as Network, Architecture, Security and Cloud Broker to resolve issues quickly.


YOUR PROFILE


3+ years of experience in software development R and RShiny
3+ years of experience with HTML&CSS
Experience for 2+ with Phyton and JavaScript
Experience in Databricks in Azure.
Experience using cloud API’s.
Good knowledge of cloud frameworks (Azure.)
Experience in developing with CI/CD pipelines and GitHub framework.
Rigor and Excellent level in algorithmics.
Strong understanding of software development processes, including Agile and DevOps methodologies.
A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.


WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback; Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: N8N & Agentification
Description:
🌟 Opportunity :

Login.works is a Lisbon-based AI boutique at the forefront of GenAI and Large Language Models. We deliver end-to-end AI solutions, helping companies unlock the power of automation through the development of agile, task-specific AI agents tailored to their unique business processes.

We focus mainly on the HealthTech and EduTech sectors, where we’re already helping innovators move faster and smarter.

Now looking for a young, curious, and growth-driven engineer who’s excited to work across different domains, learn fast, and have fun building impactful AI solutions from day one.

🚀 Responsibilities :


Design, build, and maintain complex automation workflows using n8n AND/OR Make AND/OR Zapier to streamline internal operations and client-facing processes.
Develop autonomous agents powered by LLMs (e.g., GPT-4) to perform intelligent tasks such as decision-making, summarization, email replies, data enrichment, and workflow orchestration.
Integrate a variety of tools and APIs, including CRMs, ERPs, communication platforms (Slack, email), cloud storage, databases, and internal tools.
Handle error management, retry mechanisms, logging, and monitoring for production-grade reliability and performance.
Maintain clean, scalable, and well-documented workflows and processes for easy handover and growth.
Continuously explore new AI and automation tools and recommend upgrades or integrations to improve operational efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, ops, marketing, data) to identify automation opportunities and translate them into technical workflows.


👤 Profile sought :


6 months working with automation platforms like n8n or Make, ideally in a fast-paced or tech-savvy environment.
Experience with Notion
Tech Stack: Comfort with JavaScript and/or Python for scripting inside automation platforms.
AI Integration: Hands-on experience embedding LLMs or AI APIs into workflows; understanding prompt engineering and fine-tuning logic is a plus.
APIs & Webhooks: Strong command of RESTful APIs, OAuth2, JSON, and webhook handling.
Systems Thinking: Capable of architecting modular, scalable, and interdependent systems of workflows.
Adaptability: Able to learn new tools quickly, experiment, and iterate fast.
Mindset: Curious, autonomous, and excited by "agentification" - turning manual processes into intelligent, evolving systems.
Communication: Great at documenting work, writing SOPs, and collaborating with non-technical stakeholders.


Education :

A Master’s degree in MsC in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.

Skills:


Deep knowledge of n8n AND/OR Make AND/OR Zapier : Capable of building complex, multi-step workflows, integrating APIs, handling webhooks, and optimizing data flow.
Custom scripting: Proficiency in JavaScript/Python within n8n or Make to extend capabilities where needed.
API fluency: Able to reverse-engineer APIs quickly, troubleshoot authentication (OAuth2, tokens), and parse JSON structures with ease.
AI Integration: Experience embedding LLMs (like GPT-4) into workflows for use cases like auto-replies, summarization, decision-making, and data enrichment.


Experience :


Compelling internship experience or personal projects that demonstrate pride and proficiency.
First exposure to client interactions and real business cases is appreciated


Nice to have :


Proficient in deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Jax, or TensorFlow.
Knowledge of NLP techniques and recent advances in LLMs.


🌍 Benefits & Culture :


A commitment to diversity and equal opportunity.
A vibrant, inclusive environment that fosters innovation and continuous learning.
Opportunities for professional growth and development in a dynamic AI-focused environment


💼 Department : Tech

📍 Location : Lisbon, Remote + Access to Coworking Office model

📆 Starting date : ASAP

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – (Revenue Management & Price Optimization) (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our team of machine learning experts to develop and implement cutting-edge models specifically tailored for price optimization. You will work closely with data scientists to deploy low latency services in production with the objective to infer customer willingness to pay and optimize bid pricing, leveraging theories of opportunity cost. Your work will directly influence pricing strategies for millions of customers.



YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


Model Deployment and Optimization: You will collaborate with data scientists to deploy and optimize machine learning models focused on price optimization ranging from an array of techniques, including and not limited to Neural Networks, Gradient Boosting methods, Genetic Algorithms, Linear Programming, and Time Series Forecasting.
Build and Maintain ML Pipelines: You will design, develop, and maintain robust pipelines specifically for deploying and scaling machine learning models that drive dynamic pricing strategies. Ensure these pipelines are scalable, reliable, and seamlessly integrated with the company's existing systems.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: You will work closely with data scientists, product managers, and software engineers to transform experimental models into operational systems that effectively drive pricing optimization and enhance business outcomes.
Monitoring and Performance Tuning: You will continuously monitor deployed models for performance and accuracy. Implement feedback loops and conduct regular updates to refine models in response to market changes and business needs.
Scalability and Automation: You will automate tasks and build infrastructure capable of handling large-scale data processing and complex model serving, ensuring systems are scalable and capable of executing real-time pricing adjustments.
Knowledge Sharing: You will document best practices and deployment workflows related to price optimization. Share technical insights and model impacts with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to foster understanding and drive strategic decisions.





YOUR SKILLS MATTER


Strong Foundations in Machine Learning Engineering: Experience in building, deploying, and maintaining ML models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python and ML Frameworks: Skilled in production-oriented machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
Experience with ML Pipeline Tools: Familiarity with tools like MLflow and Airflow for managing machine learning workflows.
Understanding of Causal Inference Models: Knowledge of A/B testing, difference-in-differences, propensity score matching, and double machine learning, as they relate to pricing.
Cloud and Big Data Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS) and big data technologies like Spark, Dask, or Polars.
Collaboration and Communication Skills: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, understanding modeling requirements, and translating them into scalable engineering solutions.
Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactive approach and a passion for solving complex pricing challenges through advanced engineering solutions.





WHAT WE OFFER


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience



About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!
Show more

  • Cloud and Big Data Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS) and big data technologies like Spark, Dask, or Polars.
  • Collaboration and Communication Skills: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, understanding modeling requirements, and translating them into scalable engineering solutions.
  • Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactive approach and a passion for solving complex pricing challenges through advanced engineering solutions.




WHAT WE OFFER

  • Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
  • Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
  • Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
  • Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
  • Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
  • Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience


About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

Title: Python Developer (Data Engineer)
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Ability to work independently and take initiative to solve technical problems.

Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical teams.

You will be part of a team of 5 developers and will report to the Data domain manager.


Analyze and refactor existing code primarily developed by data engineers.
Establish and maintain modular and clean development standards.
Experience with code reviews and provide feedback to improve code quality and development practices.
Write and execute unit tests, integration tests, performance tests, and regression tests to ensure code robustness and quality.
Ensure migration and compatibility with recent versions of Python 3 while managing the existing code.
Apply the SOLID principles of object-oriented design to ensure code quality and maintainability.
Work with tools and environments such as Cloudera to manage and optimize data.
Understand and apply distributed computing principles to optimize data processing and computation.


DevOps Responsibilities


Experience with GitLab CI/CD for automation of build and deployment processes.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to understand and improve existing data pipelines.
Implement Continuous Integration (CI) using Jenkins and Jenkins files/groovy, SonarQube
Familiarity with SonarQube for code quality analysis.
Develop, deploy, and manage containerized applications using Docker.
Understanding of deployment strategies using Virtuozzo Containers and Docker.
Knowledge of Cloudera platform and its integration with Python applications.
Experience with Jira API for task and project management.
Familiarity with Nexus Repository for artifact management.
Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to optimize performance.
Knowledge of package management with PyPI and pip.
Auto feed DEV, SIM, UAT envs

Methodology

Work in an Agile methodology, participating in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.

Qualifications

Proven experience (3+ years) in Python development, with a strong understanding of object-oriented and modular programming principles.


Good knowledge of Python 3 and the challenges associated with migrating from older versions.
Deep understanding of the SOLID principles of object-oriented design.
Expertise in code refactoring and improving code quality.
Proficiency in unit testing, integration testing, performance testing, and regression testing.
Experience with distributed computing principles and optimizing data processing (for example: Spark).
Understanding of data modelling and creating data structures on Hadoop.
Experience with big data environments, particularly Cloudera, is a significant plus.


DevOps Skills


CI/CD Pipeline Automation
Version Control & Branching
Deployment Automation
Artifact Management
Containerization & Orchestration
Automation & Monitoring
Show more

Title: Sr. Data Scientist US A2A Payments & Open Banking
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



As a Sr. Data Scientist, you will report to the Sr. Director of Data Science & Machine Learning and partner with risk, engineering and product to provide cutting-edge decision science to A2A payment risk. The right candidate will possess strong data science and machine learning background, with demonstrated experience in building, training, implementing and optimizing advanced ML models for payments.



The successful candidate will have experience in risk management for payments, preferably in open banking, and a solid understanding of both fraud and credit risk. They will be able to partner with product and engineering teams to scope solutions to deliver real time transaction decisioning. This role represents an exciting opportunity to make key contributions to a strategic offering for Visa. The candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and excellent collaboration skills.



Responsibilities



Be an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming innovative ways to use data to manage risk in open banking



Use predictive modeling and mine data from company databases and/or open banking sources to decrease payment losses while optimizing the consumer and merchant experience



Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques both from external data and across the Visa network



Extract and understand data to improve the understanding of risk and develop visualizations to make your complex analyses accessible to a broad audience



Deep understanding of fraud patterns and how to systematically detect and stop fraudsters



Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy including control groups, decline inference techniques, and run time optimization



Partner with product and engineering to identify improvements that will reduce the loss exposure or improve the customer experience of A2A Payments



Support sales and account management in a consultative manner on optimizing and communicating the risk strategies for individual merchants



Build strong relationships with key stakeholders at the working level to execute with excellence and align closely with Visa’s risk team



This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.





Qualifications



Basic Qualifications



8 years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or 5 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 2 years of work experience with a PhD


Preferred Qualifications



9+ years of relevant work experience and a Bachelor’s Degree or 7 or more relevant years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3+ years of experience with a PhD
Experience in payment risk management is highly preferred and experience in open banking either in North America, United Kingdom, and/ or Europe (e.g. ACH, BACS, Faster Payments, RTP, SEPA) would be extremely helpful with preference given to US experience
Experience with data mining and statistical modeling such as regression, clustering techniques, decision trees, etc. is required and application to payment and/or risk use cases is preferred
High level of competence in SQL, Python, Spark/Scala, and Unix/Linux scripts
Real world experience using Hadoop and the related query engines (Hive /Impala) for big data processing
Ability to construct model features utilizing open-banking data, in-house data,and/or third-party data to enhance rules and models
Experience utilizing models and developing features for real time graphicaltools and with highly complex networks is highly desired
Exposure to creating requirements in partnership with product and engineering teams for data science infrastructure used in real-time transaction decisioning
Comfort in working with agile lifecycle and/or tracking and process management tools, e.g., JIRA
Good business acumen and experience interpreting data to draw business insights and drive actionable strategies
Team oriented, energetic, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style
Demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor with strong attention to detail


Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Fullstack Developer (AI)
Description:
You’ll be focused in


Helping on all areas of software development, choosing the right technologies and frameworks for the problem in hand
Implementing new APIs from the ground up
Building front-end applications through appealing visual design
Contributing to tech and architecture decisions
Providing maintenance and optimize the existing code base always aware of SOLID principles and following Clean Code principles
Working with AWS and CI/CD pipelines.



In order to succeed, you’ll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience working as a Fullstack Developer, working on the backend with object-oriented programming languages
Experience with Golang, Java or Python
Experience in the conception and implementation of software solutions
Adaptability and openness to learn new object oriented languages
Interest in TDD and pair programming
Strong communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken.



Nice to have


Experience in AI environments
Experience with Typescript and React.js



About The Team

The Fullstack Developer will have full coverage of the project lifecycle and will work collaboratively with all team members. VWDS is looking for experts that embrace all technology in both Front End and Back End and who are motivated by our ways of working: Extreme programming (always two developers working on the same task to ensure successfully live review), lean methodology and TDD.

Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗

Title: Full-Stack Engineer (Generative AI)
Description:
About Us

Jitera is an AI startup with the mission to "Build the Next Era of Software Development." We are revolutionizing the future of software development through generative AI. We are enhancing quality and speed across all phases of software development—from requirements definition to software design, development, testing, and operations—by implementing innovative processes powered by generative AI. We are also advancing technical developments that leverage the unique characteristics of generative AI, such as the automatic generation of system design documents from source code and automated test code generation based on requirements. Since 2019, Jitera has provided software development services and low-code products. Following the release of ChatGPT in November 2022, we anticipated the era of generative AI and pivoted our low-code product strategy. In September 2024, we launched "Jitera," our AI agent. We are experiencing rapid revenue growth with successful implementations across dozens of enterprise companies.

Global & Fully Remote

Since launching our business in 2019, Jitera has been building a borderless organization in pursuit of becoming a global leader. We have adopted a fully remote work policy as our fundamental approach. Currently, our teams span across Asia, Europe, and the United States, attracting top-tier talent from around the world. We are entering an incredibly exciting phase as we write a new chapter in history as a globally expanding company. This position is open to candidates in the APAC and EMEA regions. Please be aware that Jitera does not provide visa sponsorship or relocation assistance.

Key Responsibilities


Work with different LLMs and AI agents. Build custom AI agents and adapt current.
Experiment with various AI approaches and mechanisms.
Design, implement, test and release high-quality software speedy.
Work with other engineers, designers, and product managers to implement various features while considering maintainability, security, and performance.
Monitor and bug fixes to ensure that customers can use the application expectedly.
Create technical documentation and communicate clearly across the product team.


Requirements


5 years of experience in software development.
Extensive experience in AI approaches and building custom agents.
Ability to design a standard application's architecture
Experience or knowledge in:
Deep understanding of Typescript
NodeJS (Typescript)
GraphQL
ReactJS (Typescript)
SQL databases (Understanding of architecture and general usage)
Business-level English skills (speaking/listening/ writing/ reading)
Good understanding of fundamental design patterns in software design.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
Ability to work independently.
Communication skills to work cooperatively in a remote team.
Ability to prepare a remote work environment where you can focus on your work with a stable network place.
You must already be based in the EMEA Region and have the legal right to work there. We do not support relocation or visas.

Desirable Experiences


AI/LLM experience
Working with different LLMs and AI providers
TypeScript/NestJS experience
Experience/usage of vector databases (e.g Milvus)
TailwindCSS experience

Technology Stack We Use

(We don't expect you to have or experience all of these, but you may meet them when working on the project)


Frontend: TypeScript, React
Backend: NodeJS, NestJS, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Database: PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ
Infrastructure: Azure, Docker, Terraform, HashiCorp Vault
CI/CD: GitHub Actions
Project management: GitHub, Jira
Documentation: Notion, Google Workspace
Communication: Slack, Google Meet


Compensation, Perks & Benefits


Competitive Salary
Health insurance allowance
Company-provided equipment
Unlimited paid time off
Tax payment (maximum 10% of salary)
Special events, off-site meetings, occasions, celebrations, and gifts.
Sponsorship for online classes according to your demand (Coursera, Datacamp, Udemy…)

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗
Show more
HTML:
You’ll be focused in

  • Helping on all areas of software development, choosing the right technologies and frameworks for the problem in hand
  • Implementing new APIs from the ground up
  • Building front-end applications through appealing visual design
  • Contributing to tech and architecture decisions
  • Providing maintenance and optimize the existing code base always aware of SOLID principles and following Clean Code principles
  • Working with AWS and CI/CD pipelines.


In order to succeed, you’ll need

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
  • Proven experience working as a Fullstack Developer, working on the backend with object-oriented programming languages
  • Experience with Golang, Java or Kotlin
  • Experience in the conception and implementation of software solutions
  • Adaptability and openness to learn new object oriented languages
  • Strong interest in TDD and pair programming
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Great English skills, both written and spoken.


Nice to have

  • Experience with TDD and tests in general
  • Experience with Pair Programming
  • Experience with Typescript and React.js


About The Team

The Fullstack Developer will have full coverage of the project lifecycle and will work collaboratively with all team members. VWDS is looking for experts that embrace all technology in both Front End and Back End and who are motivated by our ways of working: Extreme programming (always two developers working on the same task to ensure successfully live review), lean methodology and TDD.

Company Benefits

  • 1200€ to equip your home office
  • 720€ gross/year home allowance
  • Performance bonus
  • Health insurance extendable to your household
  • Wellbeing program extendable to your household
  • Life insurance
  • Pension fund
  • Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
  • Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
  • Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)


Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment

  • Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
  • Flexible working hours
  • Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
  • Pet friendly environment
  • Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
  • Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding


About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗

Title: Senior AI Engineer - Platform gen AI
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll be a member of a team in our European global technology hubs. McKinsey’s Tech Ecosystem function is responsible for developing and delivering all technology solutions for the firm’s internal use. We are taking a cloud-first approach to transform our data platforms and analytical applications across the firm.

We are seeking an experienced cloud data expert to shape and accelerate the delivery of target state cloud-based platforms and the migration of existing data assets to the cloud. We are looking for a specialist data engineer who loves to build our data solutions on the cloud that enhances our capability to build great data-driven products, AI/ML capabilities and next-gen client and colleague experiences in a high-energy agile environment.

Your Impact

We are looking for an AI Engineer with expertise in migration of enterprise data platforms who is passionate about cloud- based data engineering using AWS services.

You’ll be a member of a global team working on a generative AI initiative, based in one of our European offices. Our McKinsey’s Tech Ecosystem function is responsible for developing and delivering all technology solutions for the firm’s internal use.

You will work in a team of data engineers to build target state platforms and migrate existing applications and products, and build next-gen data platforms, contributing to emerging technologies.

You will be responsible for working in the migration of enterprise data platforms onto the cloud to help accelerate the firm’s cloud-first transformation. As an expert cloud data engineer, you will develop innovative data ingestion solutions to integrate across on-premises and SaaS ecosystems.

You will work with a team of data engineers that works across the global hubs to build target state platforms and migrate existing applications and products. You will also be part of an effort to build next-gen data platforms on the cloud to enable our Enterprise colleagues with rapid data access and incubate emerging technologies.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Expertise in developing and optimizing generative AI models and crafting effective prompts
Proficiency in Transformer, Deep Neural Network (DNN), and Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) architectures
Experience with agent-based modeling and approaches in AI systems
Strong background in deep algorithmic problem-solving and performance optimization
Proficiency in both low-level (C++, Rust) and high-level (Python, Scala) programming languages
Extensive experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP), including cloud architecture, containerization, and cloud-native data processing
Knowledge of cloud spend management and financial operations (FinOps) to optimize cloud costs
Skilled in developing and maintaining ETL and ELT pipelines, handling large-scale data (terabyte scale+), and deep RDBMS/SQL experience; SPARQL/SHACL knowledge is a bonus
Understanding of ML algorithms' impact on time, energy, and cost, and experience managing ML clusters using cloud-native solutions, SLURM, or Kubernetes
Ability to select appropriate hardware based on performance and load requirements for machine learning tasks
Show more

Title: Global Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Commercial Analytics Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Global Commercial Insights team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Global Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving global commercial strategy. As a Global Insights Senior Associate, you will support development of global analytical tools and capabilities that enable Global Insights teams to leverage secondary data to derive insights and help accelerate business decisions to support products and pipeline assets across therapy areas. Additionally, you will assist in landscape research across therapy areas and disease states to support global commercial deliverables including brand planning, opportunity assessments, global performance tracking, etc.

The individual in this role must be willing to solve ambiguous problems by leveraging both technical and consultative skills sets

Responsibilities will include:


Design, implement, and optimize global analytical tools and frameworks that enable Global Insights teams to extract insights from secondary data, supporting data-driven decision-making.
Build secondary data analytics toolbox to train and guide the Global Insights teams to efficiently use secondary data for insights generation for several global commercial deliverables.
Build ETL processes (Extract, Transform, & Load) for several data sources, analyze patterns and trends, and develop data models to support business needs.
Design systems for data storage, processing, and integration while ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau/Power BI reports & dashboards with AI-driven analytics, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance.
Ensure clear documentation for reports, dashboards, caveats, and processes for long-term usability.
Explore new data sources, methodologies, and visualization techniques (including AI-based techniques and methodologies) to enhance insights generation and increase the impact of secondary analytics in decision-making influencing global commercial strategy across portfolio.
Utilize syndicated and real-world data sources (e.g., IQVIA, claims data, epidemiology data) to generate dashboards for key metrics across diseases.
Conduct landscape assessments across multiple therapy areas and disease states, identifying key market trends and unmet needs to support global commercial deliverables.
Set priorities, develop and manage multiple projects and timelines simultaneously.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Master’s degree and 3 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of analytics, reporting, data engineering, data science and / or business analysis experience
University Degree in data science, commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Familiarity with technologies and applications, and hands-on experience to analyze, synthesize, and integrate various secondary data
Knowledge in data, analytics, research, and/or dashboarding & reporting approach
Experience with commonly used biopharmaceutical industry secondary datasets and databases
A keen eye for design, with the ability to develop compelling Power BI and Tableau dashboards
Ability to write and execute SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Skilled in tools like Tableau, Python, and PowerBI
Knowledge of AI and ability to integrate AI-based solutions in workflow / dashboard / tools / analytics
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Ability to identify and resolve technical issues
Knowledge of modern cloud-based warehouse technologies such as Snowflake, Amazon Redshift is preferred
Ability to drive implementation to enhance methodologies and standard processes in secondary data analytics
Strong oral and written presentation skills, with ability to explain complex concepts verbally or visually via PowerPoint / Excel
Evident project management skills—able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and data sources
Understanding of the Bio-Pharmaceutical and biotech industry trends and operations
Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more

  • Ability to work collaboratively in team-based environment

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Lisbon

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company’s flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

  • Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.


Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in the company’s employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance


We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Operations Research (Revenue Management & Price Optimization) (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our team of data science and machine learning experts to shape next-generation pricing strategies. We combine cutting-edge techniques—like price elasticity modeling, bid price strategies, and advanced ML—to optimize pricing decisions for millions of customers. Our work directly drives efficient revenue management processes and enhances the user experience.

We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist – Operations Research with deep revenue management expertise and a solid background in mathematical optimization. Ideal candidates have hands-on experience in dynamic pricing, bid price optimization, and have worked in (or closely with) the airline or car rental industry.



YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


Revenue Management & Price Optimization Design, develop, and deploy advanced revenue management systems focusing on dynamic pricing and bid price optimization strategies.
Operations Research Modeling Formulate and solve complex optimization problems (linear, nonlinear, dynamic, stochastic) to maximize revenue and support key decision-making processes.
Demand Forecasting & Customer Willingness-to-Pay Create and refine forecasting models using time series and machine learning methods to capture customer demand and willingness-to-pay.
Algorithm & Tool Development Build and maintain robust algorithms that integrate seamlessly with production systems, ensuring efficiency and scalability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with product managers, data engineers, and software developers to deploy end-to-end solutions and continuously improve analytical models.
Thought Leadership Stay current on the latest research in revenue management, operations research, and machine learning. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members.





YOUR SKILLS MATTER


Industry Experience 5+ years in data science and operations research roles, ideally in car rental, airlines, or similar travel/hospitality sectors.
Revenue Management Expertise Proven track record implementing or optimizing revenue management systems and pricing strategies.
Optimization & Solvers Strong background in mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, integer programming), solvers, and algorithm design (dynamic/stochastic programming).
Machine Learning & Forecasting Proficient in demand forecasting, time series modeling, and modern ML techniques (especially regression).
Programming Skills Expertise in Python for data analysis, modeling, and production deployment. Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Analytical Mindset Ability to translate complex business problems into actionable analytical tasks and clearly communicate findings to various audiences.
Pricing & Bid Price Optimization Practical experience designing or implementing bid price models in large-scale revenue management systems (plus).
Education Master’s degree (or higher) in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field (plus).





WHAT WE OFFER


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience



About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

Title: React Developer
Description:
REACT DEVELOPER

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for motivated Consultants with experience in React development to join our teams in Lisbon.

In this role you will be responsible for:


Frontend development
Building APIs
Define and design component driven solutions, being able to take the most advantage by using MERN/MEAN stack (Solution architect)
Promote and exhibit solutions and demos for customers, partners and internal teams
Database design
Mobile development (Dart/Flutter)
Containers and cloud development


YOUR PROFILE


Expert in React, React Native, Flutter and Next.js
Expert in building APIs using Nest.js and Node.js
Good knowledge in Mongo DB
Knowledge in mobile development (Dart/Flutter)
Experience working in Agile environment as scrum team member
Knowledge in containers and cloud development is a plus


WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback; Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Com mais de 8 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.


Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:

  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.



O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Experiência miníma 3 anos em projetos de desenvolvimento com Python;
  • Experiência com React.js;
  • Autonomia em implementação, testes e manutenção de REST APIs;
  • Contacto com testes seguindo padrões TDD (Test-Driven Development);
  • Bom nível de inglês, falado e escrito.



Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.


We walk with you!


Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!




Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Scientist.




You Will Need

Experience with R, Python and SQL programming languages;
Knowledge of AI, application of machine learning techniques, including deep learning;
Expertise in data manipulation and engineering processes;
Proficiency in BI and data visualization tools such as PowerBI;
Fluent in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have

BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience with Azure Cloud.




With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Machine Learning Scientist II (Moderation & Fraud)
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.




At Tripadvisor, we never stop learning. This is true both individually and as a company, where constant experimentation helps us to understand how we can continue to grow and improve the user experience for our 500 million unique monthly visitors worldwide. Data-driven decision making is at the core of what we do.




Location: Please note, this position will be either office, hybrid or remote-based within Portugal.




About Machine Learning at Tripadvisor




Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the Machine Learning Team creates systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. It applies cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas such as personalization, recommenders, computer vision, and natural language processing (NLP). To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!




What You Will Be Doing




As a Machine Learning Scientist specializing in content moderation and fraud detection, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our content integrity and user experience at Tripadvisor. You will be responsible for designing and implementing advanced machine learning models aimed at assessing the fairness, reliability, and validity of user-generated content. Your work will directly impact how travelers interact with our platform, ensuring they receive high quality, trustworthy information and recommendations.




You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including content specialists/analysts, software engineers, and product managers, to translate complex data into actionable insights. Your insights will guide the development of robust systems that enhance user trust and satisfaction. We seek someone with a deep understanding of machine learning principles, strong analytical skills, and a passion for creating equitable and impactful solutions.




Skills & Experience





Advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.


Strong background in machine learning and statistics.


Solid foundation on data structures and algorithms.


Ability to write complex SQL queries. Experience with Snowflake is a bonus.


Proficiency in Python.


At least 2 years of relevant, practical experience.


Experience with MLOps processes, platforms and tools.


[Bonus] Experience with fraud detection and content moderation.


[Bonus] Experience with LLMs and GAI models, including prompt engineering techniques such as N-shot prompting, Chain of Thought (CoT) prompting and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).


[Bonus] Experience with deep learning, modern NLP & machine vision techniques.





We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to contribute to the development, industrialization, and maintenance of AI and analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).




Key Responsibilities

Develop infrastructure modules, reusable components, and architecture templates for AI/Analytics applications.
Industrialize, maintain, and improve AI and analytics solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Manage infrastructure with a focus on reliability, security, and scalability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-performance AI solutions.




Requirements

8+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
Experience in Python & SQL programming.
Practical experience in MLOps.
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform preferred).
Strong knowledge of Data Engineering principles.
Experience with REST APIs and microservices.
Fluency in English (mandatory).
Nice-to-have: Experience with Vertex AI and DBT.




Location: Lisbon, Portugal

Work Model: Hybrid (3 days per week in the office)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 10 months




If you meet the requirements, send us your CV in English plus daily rate to j.sierra@asenium.com or apply directly!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are based in Estonia and Cyprus, and we operate globally. We love to work remotely and travel the world. Having freedom, ownership and passion for recruitment are key for us.

We hire amazing tech talent for great companies

We coach highly motivated Professionals to get better careers

We empower recruiters to hire more and better Talent.

Do you want to help us to grow?

Hiire is helping CEGID, a European leader in cloud business management, hire a Data Scientist to advance the data science capabilities.

About The Role

CEGID seeks a Data Scientist to develop machine learning models, focusing on building robust models that enhance decision-making processes and drive business intelligence.

You'll be working within the AI Factory dedicated to advancing CEGID's management software through AI innovation. The primary goal is to seamlessly integrate AI features into the product line, either by enhancing functionality and user experience or by recreating user workflows to take full advantage of AI technology.

What You'll Do

  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of machine learning models tailored for finance and accounting applications;
  • Explore and develop generative AI models to address challenges and opportunities in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Collaborate with finance and accounting experts, software engineers, and data engineers to integrate machine learning solutions into existing systems;
  • Demonstrate an interest in and familiarity with MLOps tools and practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models.

What We're Looking For

  • Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline;
  • Proven experience (2+ years) in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, familiarity with MLOps tools and practices;
  • Experience with generative AI models and/or NLP is a plus.

Why Join Our Client?

  • Attractive and transparent remuneration from recruitment;
  • Annual performance-based bonus aligned with individual and company goals;
  • Hybrid work model and flexible working hours;
  • 25 days of vacation per year;
  • Health insurance;
  • Access to online learning platforms and internal academy;
  • Be part of a dynamic, innovative, and growing team.

Ready to take the next step? Apply now and help shape your future, ours, and our clients’ industries’ future!

Title: Data Scientist (Mid-Senior)
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.




Your Role

As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in contributing to the development and implementation of AI models and algorithms to address complex business challenges. Your key responsibilities will include:

Taking ownership of data science initiatives and projects, demonstrating a proactive and results-driven approach.
Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and providing data-driven recommendations.
Collaborating seamlessly with multidisciplinary teams to comprehend business needs, designing, and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms.
Leveraging big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks for processing and analyzing large volumes of data, or equivalent cloud computing expertise.
Developing and deploying predictive models and algorithms in real-world production environments.
Conducting comprehensive exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Effectively communicating finding and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Embracing a data-driven, solution-oriented, and critical mindset, fostering teamwork and collaboration.




Your Profile

2 or more years of experience in data science roles with a focus on statistical modeling, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages, including SQL, Python, and distributed/cloud processing framework such as Pyspark.
Exhibit familiarity with advanced analytics libraries/frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn.
Robust understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and various machine learning techniques.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and libraries such as Seaborn, Matplotlib, or Plotly.
Proven ability to work with large datasets and experience in distributed computing frameworks, either on-premises or in the cloud.
Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills for addressing complex data challenges.
Hold a solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Engineering, Data & AI, or Computer Sciences.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS is a plus)
Mandatory fluency in English.




What You'll Love About Working Here

Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
Engage in exciting national and international projects;
Hybrid work;
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
Training and certifications programs;
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
Great office locations.




Why Capgemini?

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Seeking an AI Engineer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?


Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.


Perks Of Becoming a Rhino


You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
Opportunities for career progression 📈
Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
Other protocols and special discounts ✨


For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:


Proven experience of at least 5 years as an AI Engineer or similar role, with a strong focus on Azure AI and Machine Learning services.
Proficiency in Python (pandas), SQL, NLP
Experience integrating insights in consumers such as web applications or Power BI
Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Experience with time series forecasting, regression analysis, anomaly detection, and clustering methods.
Ability to work in an agile environment, rapidly prototyping and iterating on solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
English level of B2 or higher
Availability to work in a full remote model from Portugal


Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Na AXIANS procuramos o talento certo, para o lugar certo. Trabalhamos diariamente para envolver as nossas pessoas num ambiente colaborativo e inclusivo, com uma cultura de proximidade. Faz também parte da nossa cultura a preocupação com o meio ambiente e a realização de ações de responsabilidade corporativa social e ambiental.

Esta pode ser a sua oportunidade de integrar um projeto de âmbito internacional, com um cliente que precisa de si para responder aos desafios da transformação digital.

💻 O CARGO

Procuramos um #TechTalent para desempenhar funções enquanto Data Scientist para um projeto na área financeira.

💡 O QUE PROCURAMOS


Linguagens de Programação: R, Python ( NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) e SQL
Machine Learning e IA: Conhecimento em IA, aplicação de técnicas de aprendizado de máquina, incluindo deep learning, para criar modelos preditivos e automatizar processos, algoritmos como regressão, árvores de decisão, redes neurais.
Manipulação e Engenharia de Dados: ETL, bancos de dados SQL / NoSQL, Spark, Hadoop, Databricks, SSIS.
BI e Visualização de Dados: Power BI, Python (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly), SSRS
Estatística e Matemática: Probabilidade, inferência estatística, álgebra linear, cálculo.
APIs e Web Scraping: Extração de dados externos via requests, BeautifulSoup, Scrapy
Cloud (Opcional): Azure


⭐O QUE PODE ESPERAR DE NÓS

Carreira profissional estável

Ao trabalhar com projetos da Axians torna-se uma mais valia a quem queremos oferecer estabilidade, através de uma carreira segura.

Perspetivas de progressão na carreira

Poderá aceder a formações e novas certificações que elevarão ainda mais as suas competências. A avaliação 360° dos managers e peers também permitirão evoluir.

Conciliação entre a área profissional e a familiar

Colaborando com a Axians há abertura para conciliar as exigências laborais com os requisitos familiares, evitando negligenciar cada uma das áreas.

Compensação evolutiva e atrativa

Ao trabalhar com clientes da Axians, terá acesso a prémios de performance, além de um pack salarial atrativo (vencimento base + benefícios). Também tem direito a seguro de saúde e consultas de psicologia gratuitas.

Identifica-se com esta vaga?

Se pensa que esta vaga é a sua cara e tem o #TechTalent que procuramos envie-nos o seu currículo, de preferência em inglês para recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com com o subject "DS.MM.PL”.

Saber mais sobre a Axians

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Python Developer!




Requirements:

Mandatory :Expertise in Python development (at least 4 years)
Expertise on best practices in terms of architecture design (AD, Storage, Managed services, etc.)
Strong expertise on security and implementation of security in IT applications and infrastructures
Expertise with large volume / optimization
Excellent level in algorithmics
Good expertise in using APIs
Good expertise of cloud frameworks (Azure batch, serviceIO, etc.)
Intent on security when coding
Expertise with Microsoft Azure cloud
Good expertise in developing CI/CD pipelines
SQL
Strong expertise of software development processes, including Agile and DevOps methodologies.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in english to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/Python”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
